elements.title: Emma Finucane (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Emma Finucane (pictured) recently became the first British woman in sixty years to win three medals at a single Olympic Games?

elements.contents: ... that researchers accidentally discovered a new antibiotic in soil bacteria?

elements.contents: ... that Budi Bowoleksono always traveled with chili paste in his briefcase?

elements.title: Henry Darger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the art of a reclusive Chicago janitor, Henry Darger, was discovered and popularized by his former landlords?

elements.title: bridges (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that cables of large suspension bridges can reach over 1 meter (3.3 ft) in diameter and weigh more than 20,000 tonnes?

elements.contents: ... that Jeremy Hambly has operated a YouTube channel about claw machines?

elements.title: world's largest McDonald's restaurant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the world's largest McDonald's restaurant closed after only six weeks of operation?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
